body_html:
@nkundiushuti that is interesting.

The documentation says that the first n rows returned (n=2 here) include the solution of the least-squares problem. I've verified that the first 2 rows of X and Y are the same so you can probably use that for now while we figure out what the rest of the output is.
body_text:
@nkundiushuti that is interesting.
The documentation says that the first n rows returned (n=2 here) include the solution of the least-squares problem. I've verified that the first 2 rows of X and Y are the same so you can probably use that for now while we figure out what the rest of the output is.
body:
@nkundiushuti that is interesting.

[The documentation](http://pytorch.org/docs/master/torch.html#torch.gels) says that the first `n` rows returned (`n=2` here) include the solution of the least-squares problem. I've verified that the first 2 rows of X and Y are the same so you can probably use that for now while we figure out what the rest of the output is.
